Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Business Data Analyst

Location: Stockholm, Sweden (Sweden primary, alternatively Finland, Denmark)

Duration: 12+ Months (Possibility of Extension)

We are looking for a Finance Remediation Specialist (Business Data Analyst) for our client in the financial sector.

As a senior Business Data Analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in ensuring the team provides relevant and timeline insights and identify opportunities to take the sanctions analytics capabilities to the next level.

What you’ll be doing:

Translating business needs into tangible analyses by understanding the business context, leveraging data to proactively provide relevant insights
Analyzing large sets of data using tools such as Hadoop and PowerBI to support projects, risk management and operational decision making.
Driving ideation and development of new analytics capabilities in collaboration with the team and other relevant stakeholders.
Driving and participating in data-related change work to improve how it is used by systems or end users.
Providing expertise and sparring for team members and as part of projects, acting as a subject matter expert for sanctions data and analytics.
Interact closely with colleagues and stakeholders across the bank to share best practices and align on common ways of working across value chains.

To succeed in this role, we believe that you:

Have strong analytical skills and a curious mindset to proactively identify important details in data and turn it into actionable insight.
Thrive in a dynamic environment where the only constant is change, learning and adapting to a complex data and IT landscape that connects across most parts of the company.
Are structured, result-oriented and set a good example for others. You enjoy and have experience of building strong stakeholder relationships to support your work.

Your experience and background:

Experience in the Financial or IT/Technology industries and familiarity with common banking industry concepts and processes. Knowledge of sanctions compliance/financial crime prevention is a strong advantage.
Experience of project or change work, capturing and understanding stakeholder requirements.
Experience of visualising and communicating complex information in a digestible format for a range of stakeholders.
Skilled user of MS Excel and PowerPoint.
Knowledge of SQL, Python and R considered a strong advantage.
Experience using Hadoop and PowerBI considered a strong advantage.
Advanced English oral and written communication in a very international and diverse team environment.
A subject-relevant degree or equivalent work experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Seco Tools we’re now looking for a Data Analyst to join us – someone who’s passionate about turning data into actionable insights. We welcome you to an exciting role in our journey to become a more data-driven organization, empowering informed decision making and achieving business outcomes through data analytics. Join us and be a part of shaping the future of our organization!

About The Job

In this position, you design, develop and implement end-end analytics solutions, primarily in Power BI. By collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to increase their utilization of data for decision making, you share your knowledge and analytics expertise. In accordance with the vision and strategy, you suggest ways and drive improvements that increase the impact of data and analytics. You actively support the development of the Analytics & BI function in generating policies, standards and procedure to increase efficiency and effectiveness.

Also included in your job is to:


Design and develop data models for utilization by applications, services and business users.
Ensure that analytics and BI solutions adhere to the level of information security and sensitivity classifications.
Communicate results and educate end-users on solutions and approaches.
Implement data models for analytics and BI purposes.
Suggest and implement improvements to our technical capabilities and processes, including planning, execution and follow-up.


The location for this position is Stockholm, Sweden or Pune, India, and we apply a hybrid work set-up, allowing you to combine office work with remote work.

Your profile

We’re looking for someone with a relevant education or equivalent knowledge gained from work experience. You’re technically interested and have a background in data analytics, data modeling and are well acquainted with Power BI. Working in a global environment calls for excellent skills in English, both verbally and in writing.

Although your background is important, your personality is your biggest asset in this role. With your excellent interpersonal- and communication skills, you’re able to build relationships and collaborate effectively with others across cultural borders. You enjoy working in an ever-changing environment – having the ability to see the bigger picture and are eager to drive change.

Our Seco culture

Seco employees across the globe share our family spirit, along with a passion for our customers and a personal commitment to ensure success in everything we do. For us, it’s also clear that our diversities form an amazing foundation for achieving great results. Visit our website, LinkedIn or Facebook to get to know us and our products further.

Contact information

For further information about this position, please contact Joel Strandh, recruiting manager, +46 (0)76 141 44 65

We’ve already decided on which advertising channels and marketing campaigns we wish to use, and respectfully decline any additional contacts in that matter.

Union contacts – Sweden

David Romlin, Unionen, +46 (0)70-608 46 90

Suncana Bandalo, Akademikerföreningen, +46 (0)70-300 10 73

Benny Christiansen, Ledarna, +46 (0)70-523 50 60

Recruitment Specialist: Therese Rutqvist

How To Apply

This recruitment has an ongoing selection process, please send your application as soon as possible, but no later than August 25, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0067832.

As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.

For more information about our recruitment process, please contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

At Seco Tools we develop and offer advanced products & solutions that make metal cutting easier. We work together with our customers to identify and implement the best solutions for their needs. The corporate culture empowers employees through shared values: Passion for our customers, Family Spirit, Personal commitment. Seco Tools has a presence in more than 75 countries and employs about 4000 people.

This recruitment has an ongoing selection process, please send your application as soon as possible, but no later than August 25, 2024. Click apply and include your resume and cover letter in English. Please note that we don’t accept applications by e-mail. Job ID: R0067832.

As we aim for a fair recruitment process, we utilize assessment tools to safeguard objectivity. When you apply for this job, you will therefore receive an invitation via email to a personality and logic ability test. Feedback comes immediately after the test has been completed and the selection process begins after the application deadline.

For more information about our recruitment process, please contact HR Services at hrservices.sweden@sandvik.com.

At Seco Tools we develop and offer advanced products & solutions that make metal cutting easier. We work together with our customers to identify and implement the best solutions for their needs. The corporate culture empowers employees through shared values: Passion for our customers, Family Spirit, Personal commitment. Seco Tools has a presence in more than 75 countries and employs about 4000 people.

Title: Data Analyst DORA
Description:
We’re looking for a talented Data Analyst to join the team responsible for the Digital Operational Resilience Act (“DORA”) implementation for our customers from the banking industry.

The team's responsibilities will span across several key areas, including the collection of business and functional requirements, including the sourcing, mapping, profiling, and modeling of data, as well as the development of a data hub/repository. Furthermore, the team will be tasked with creating an automated ETL process and a reporting engine and mechanism to comply with DORA requirements.

Joining Sii Sweden means gaining access to the perks of a seasoned IT consulting company. From training sessions and webinars to collaborative knowledge-sharing sessions with colleagues, we offer a comprehensive compensation package that includes insurance, pension plans, and wellness benefits. Thrive in our stable and forward-thinking environment, where your growth and success are our priorities.

We can't wait to have you on board!




Your role:

Build the register of information at the entity, sub-consolidated, and consolidated level by the Digital Operational Resilience Act
Gather data from various sources, create data models, design and write ETL scripts, and generate detailed reports
Implement technical standards on the standard templates for the information register related to all contractual arrangements for the use of ICT services
Plan and schedule interviews with clients’ Application Owners and Providers to identify DORA data needs
Analyze DORA Data Requirements
Proactively plan and drive the requirement work with ROI key stakeholders, future ROI application owners, and providers
Design Use Cases




Your skills:

Proficiency in Python and/or R for data analysis and visualization
Previous work with designing and writing ETL scripts
Strong knowledge of SQL for querying and managing databases
Experience with tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or QlikView
Expertise in cleaning, transforming, and preparing data for analysis
Familiarity with DORA regulations
Experience working effectively within cross-functional teams

Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Om tjänsten

How do we best source energy for fossil-free electricity sales?

Providing our customers with fossil-free electricity at competitive prices means we need to understand their needs and the market and be able to handle the attached risks. The Commodities Intelligence department is currently looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join us on our journey.

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will belong to the Commodities Intelligence department which is responsible for the Financial Risk Management, Power Pricing and development of our BI-tools for our Sales segments. The team work with all customers and segments in the Nordic countries and you will have colleagues in both Sweden and Finland. Besides your team colleagues, you will work closely with Portfolio managers, Business control, Vattenfall IT and lots of other people.

Your main responsibility as a Business Intelligence Analyst is to develop and take responsibility for the teams data tables and BI tools, which are crucial for our financial risk management, business analysis and reporting.

The main focus of this position is to build, develop and secure quality in new or existing Power BI reports. You will work with the reports from start to finish, from ordering raw data from the Source systems to publishing a user-friendly power BI report that meets the stakeholder's demand for follow-up, risk management, analysis and decision-making.

To be able to apply the correct business logic in the data transformation, it is important to have or gain a deep understanding of the electricity market and electricity Sales business. It is also important to be able to work in a cross-functional environment where stakeholders has different requirements and needs.

Our ambition is that your work will form the basis for improved risk management and increased quality in our analysis and reports.

Din bakgrund

To be successful in this role, we believe that you have the following:


University degree in engineering, finance, mathematics or other similar field of education
Experience of SQL- programming, preferably Azure / Databricks
Experience of data modelling and data management
Good command of written and spoken English


It´ll be beneficial if you also have:


Experience working in the electricity market
Experience working in sales and marketing settings
Experience from Power BI
Additional programming knowledge, preferably Python.
API management
Experience in financial derivatives
Experience working in a scrum team and have related skill set
Good command of written and spoken Swedish


As a person you have an analytical mindset and the ability to quickly assess and understand relations between involved systems and tools. You´re customer-focused and business-minded, as well as a good team player with good communication skills.

Mer information

We offer a challenging and international work environment and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues as ‘Ask and Share’ concept is essential for the way we work. We offer attractive employment conditions (smart working, flexible working hours and a good-work-life balance) and opportunities for personal and professional development. Click here for further information.

Location: Solna.

We welcome your application including cover letter and CV in English via the link below. Last day to apply is August 13th 2024. The advertising period has been extended due to summer holidays and we´ll review all applications when the application has closed.

We´re using tests in this recruitment process and an online test will be sent to all applicants as a first step in the recruitment process when the application has closed.

For more information about the position you are welcome to contact hiring manager André Hellström, andre.hellstrom@vattenfall.com. If you have questions regarding the recruitment process you are welcome to contact recruiter Jennifer Wikström, jennifer.wikstroem@vattenfall.com.

Trade Union Representatives, to be reached through Vattenfall’s switchboard, +46 (8) 739 50 00, are Rolf Olsson (Akademikerna), Simon Salomonsson (Unionen), Mikael Mukka (SEKO) and Cecilia Bodin (Ledarna).

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be a good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation. Click here for further information.

Om oss

Vattenfall is one of Europe’s largest producers and retailers of electricity and heat. Our main markets are Sweden, Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and the UK. The Vattenfall Group has approximately 20,000 employees. We have been electrifying industries, powering homes and transforming life through innovation for more than 100 years. We now want to make fossil free living possible and we are driving the transition to a sustainable energy system.
Show more

Title: Graduate Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Graduate Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


A recent graduate with background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

💰Annual compensation review

🏆Recognition rewards

🏝 Annual holiday leave

👶Parental Leave

🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme

🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.


Show more

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Fraud & Data Analyst to The Fraud Strategy & Analytics Team
Description:
About Entercard

Entercard is one of Scandinavia’s leading credit market companies with over 1.7 million customers across Sweden, Norway, Denmark and Finland. We are dedicated to providing innovative and secure financial solutions, and our commitment to integrity, transparency, and customer satisfaction is unwavering. At Entercard, we believe in fostering a collaborative environment where every team member can grow and make a significant impact.

Job Description

The Fraud Strategy & Analytics team consists of four analysts who own the Entercard Group’s short- and long-term fraud strategy. As a Senior Analyst, you will have a broad strategic mandate to mitigate 1st and 3rd party fraud in the credit card and consumer loan segments. Additionally, you will help set budgets and forecasts, perform continuous risk assessments, and manage strategies and rules. In this dynamic position, you will:


Contribute to the construction of short- and long-term fraud prevention strategies.
Find, analyze, and investigate patterns related to card and application fraud.
Propose solutions that mitigate the company’s fraud exposure based on your analyses.
Develop strategic rules and track their performance over time.


The ideal candidate has a strong background in data analysis, with a particular focus on fraud detection and prevention. As a Senior Fraud & Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding our customers and business from fraudulent activities by leveraging advanced data analytics and developing effective strategies.

Profile

We Believe The Right Candidate For This Position Has


A relevant education and 5+ years of experience in fraud detection, data analysis, or a similar role within the financial services industry.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages like SQL, Python or similar is required.


You should be open-minded, creative, enjoy problem-solving, and be eager to learn about fraud. To succeed in this position, you need to have an analytical mindset, be curious about new ideas, embrace change as a part of your daily work, and have strong verbal skills and the ability to present ideas effectively. Our corporate language is English, and you need to be fluent in both spoken and written English. Proficiency in a Scandinavian language (Swedish/Norwegian/Danish) would be beneficial but is not required.

In this recruitment, Entercard is collaborating with Blaq Executive Search AB. If this position sounds interesting and aligns with your experiences and competencies, please contact Henrik Flood at 0739-830500 or *protected email*.
Show more

Title: Analyst
Description:
Experienced Analyst With Interest In CRM And Data-driven Personalization

Insurance is all about life. And it is all about data. At If we are developing technical solutions that have the power to turn misfortunes into possibilities and dreams into reality. We are now looking for an analyst with a passion for data, analytics, and customer experience to help understand our customers even better.

About The Role

In this role you will be working in a cross-functional agile team, increasing insights, and contributing to creating the best insurance solutions and experiences for our customers. This will be done through providing insights on customer life-events affecting customers’ insurance needs, supporting with reporting and analysis regarding activities, customer base development, and customer satisfaction and more.

We strive to be an organization where you as an analyst can develop and be challenged, both personally and within analytics. To enable your work, you will have access to flexible and robust data platforms both for analytics and visualization. And to help you in your quest for insight you will for cheered for, and supported by, 50+ data professionals in a Nordic Data and Analytics unit.

We offer

In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer.

Here are some of the benefits of working at If:


An including work environment where everyone is welcome
Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
Possibility of hybrid workplace
Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
Great insurance benefits



Who are you?

We think that you have a general interest in analytics and customers. You have strong technology and analytics skills. You want to work cross functionally to improve customer journeys and to help us understand our customers even better. You have previously worked with analytics and have a positive, sharing, and proactive mindset. We also believe that you are excellent at communicating insights to stakeholders, both technical and non-technical.

Key Responsibilities Include


Creating actionable insights from large volumes of data.
Building visualizations to support business in understanding performance and identify areas of improvement.
Connecting data and insights to strategies to improve the customer journey.
Utilize relevant data to support personalized experiences to individual customers.
Proactively identifying new opportunities within data and analytics.
Supporting users in their understanding of data & analytics, including evaluation of business results and communication with users.



Your Background


Excellent in data transformation and programming (e.g., SQL, Python).
Data visualization experience from BI tools such as Tableau or Microsoft Power BI.
You have a good understanding of CDPs and related technologies.
Hands-on experience with a CDP is a plus.
Experience from data driven CRM teams or CRM analytics is a plus.
Relevant university degree.
Fluent in English, understanding one or more of the Nordic languages



Additional Facts

Application deadline: Last date to apply is 25th of August 2024 – application review will start immediately so don’t wait with sending in your application. All applications will go through our recruitment system.
To apply for the position: Please attach your CV. You don’t need to write a cover letter, instead please answer the questions that come up when you are applying.
Work location: Sweden (Göteborg/Stockholm) or Finland (Espoo/Turku)
Travelling: Some travelling is required.
Start: As soon as possible/by agreement.

Questions about the position or the process can be directed to the country chapter lead:

For Sweden contact Kenny Karlsson at kenny.karlsson@if.se

For Finland contact Kirsi Rastas at kirsi.rastas@if.se

About Us

We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.

To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.

We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.

We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.

Come and join us!
Show more

Here are some of the benefits of working at If:

  • An including work environment where everyone is welcome
  • Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
  • Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
  • Possibility of hybrid workplace
  • Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
  • Great insurance benefits


Who are you?

We think that you have a general interest in analytics and customers. You have strong technology and analytics skills. You want to work cross functionally to improve customer journeys and to help us understand our customers even better. You have previously worked with analytics and have a positive, sharing, and proactive mindset. We also believe that you are excellent at communicating insights to stakeholders, both technical and non-technical.

Key Responsibilities Include

  • Creating actionable insights from large volumes of data.
  • Building visualizations to support business in understanding performance and identify areas of improvement.
  • Connecting data and insights to strategies to improve the customer journey.
  • Utilize relevant data to support personalized experiences to individual customers.
  • Proactively identifying new opportunities within data and analytics.
  • Supporting users in their understanding of data & analytics, including evaluation of business results and communication with users.


Your Background

  • Excellent in data transformation and programming (e.g., SQL, Python).
  • Data visualization experience from BI tools such as Tableau or Microsoft Power BI.
  • You have a good understanding of CDPs and related technologies.
  • Hands-on experience with a CDP is a plus.
  • Experience from data driven CRM teams or CRM analytics is a plus.
  • Relevant university degree.
  • Fluent in English, understanding one or more of the Nordic languages


Additional Facts

Application deadline: Last date to apply is 25th of August 2024 – application review will start immediately so don’t wait with sending in your application. All applications will go through our recruitment system.
To apply for the position: Please attach your CV. You don’t need to write a cover letter, instead please answer the questions that come up when you are applying.
Work location: Sweden (Göteborg/Stockholm) or Finland (Espoo/Turku)
Travelling: Some travelling is required.
Start: As soon as possible/by agreement.

Questions about the position or the process can be directed to the country chapter lead:

For Sweden contact Kenny Karlsson at kenny.karlsson@if.se

For Finland contact Kirsi Rastas at kirsi.rastas@if.se

About Us
We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.

To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.

We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.

We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.

Come and join us!

Title: LIA - Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About Carla

We believe that more people should be able to drive electric. Therefore, we have set out to build the safest, most convenient and transparent way to sell, buy, or lease an electric car. Carla was founded in 2020 in Stockholm, with strong VC backing. We have since then sold and delivered thousands of cars all over Sweden, and can boast over having the happiest customers in the car industry!

Who are we looking for?

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst Intern who is passionate about data and eager to dive into a variety of tasks. The ideal candidate is driven, digitally savvy, and possesses excellent written communication skills. A “doer” mentality is essential, as you’ll be handling diverse responsibilities ranging from data analysis to visualization.

We Believe That The Ideal Candidate Have


Strong written communication skills (in Swedish and English)
Basic knowledge of SQL, BigQuery and Analytics
Experience using Excel and Google Sheets
Ability to analyze and interpret data to support marketing decisions
Create basic visualizations in tools such as Looker


What can we offer?

We promise a steep learning curve within digital marketing and e-commerce with a particular focus on data analysis. As a Data Analyst Intern at Carla, you will be given a great opportunity to learn, explore and gain experience within the field of data analysis to create real impact for a fast-growing start-up company.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We're looking for an ambitious and driven Data Engineer to join our team in building our modern scalable data platform!

Two is bringing the very best of B2C e-commerce to B2B. We're passionate about building solutions that enable B2B Merchants to sell more, faster, and more efficiently. Growing 30% month-on-month, our goal is to become the world's largest B2B payment solution by 2027. We're backed by the very best VCs in the world — raised over €30m from Sequoia, Shine, Local Globe, Antler, Posten and influential angel investors in Fintech.

Two is built by a passionate and energetic team with second-time founders with successful exits. We are a small, but mighty team leading Two into new countries. We have a global mindset, but deeply understand local nuance. We are entrepreneurs at heart, problem-solving to launch new countries end to end. We are team players that execute diligently from ideation to reality. We believe in diversity in opinions and ideas and expect all employees to think like an owner.

Location

We are seeking a candidate to join one of our offices in London, Glasgow, Oslo or Stockholm. Our work model embraces a hybrid approach, offering employees the flexibility to work both onsite and from home.

About The Role

We are currently looking to expand our Data Team with an experienced and ambitious Data Engineer with a passion for building a highly scalable data platform!

You'd be joining a fast-paced Data Team whose mission is to empower business decisions by provisioning quality data information and ML Engineers by building scalable Feature Engineering platform. We have a data-driven culture and believe that data wealth and the ability to leverage it effectively is what sets us apart!

You will be working closely with stakeholders across business divisions to enable quality decisions based on clean, trusted, and enriched data.

This is a fantastic opportunity in one of the most exciting and fast-growing start-ups of the global Fintech industry with the mission to revolutionise B2B payments!

What You Will Be Doing

The role requires a proactive and independent individual, who understands the challenges of working in a startup, wants to own the problem, and is able to design data solutions with great attention to the quality of products being delivered. Your main responsibilities will be to:


Lead the design and implementation of a scalable and reliable data platform at Two
Scale our Data Analytics platform across the company in the most cost-effective way
Help establish a data culture across the business by implementing a self-serve data platform
Build pipelines to enrich internal data with data from 3rd parties by using different integration tools such as Airflow, Airbytes, etc
Be the key player in architecting and building our Feature Engineering and Feature Store platforms to be leveraged by the Data Science and Machine Learning teams
Ensure quality of data delivered to end user



Technologies We Use:


Our foundational core products run as micro-services on Kubernetes
Python and Golang for our back-end applications
PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Spark for distributed data storage and compute
Two cloud infrastructure is hosted on Google Cloud Platform
Our CI/CD pipeline consists of Github Actions, Helm and Terraform



Requirements


2-5 years of experience in working with the cloud platforms, ideally GCP or AWS
Experience in designing and building data pipelines in the cloud, working experience with data integration tools or APIs ( Airflow, dbt, Fivetran, Airbytes etc.)
Strong SQL skills and ability to tune SQL performance in RDBMS (PostgreSQL) as well as columnar store (BigQuery, Redshift)
Strong understanding of CI/CD principals
DevOps experience is a bonus
Track record of successfully achieving your set goals and meeting tight deadlines
You are ambitious, reliable, and resilient with a can-do attitude, always with a suggestion for a solution rather than just explaining a problem!



Benefits


25 days paid time off per year + public holidays 🌴
Annual allowance to spend on anything that will contribute to your mental or physical health 🤸
Allowance towards a phone device every 24 months (from your 6th month anniversary) 📱
Annual allowance for learning and training 📚
Show more

Title: Strateg Data & Analys, IT
Description:
Varje dag reser närmare 900 000 personer med den allmänna kollektivtrafiken i Stockholm. Höga krav på en väl utbyggd, lättillgänglig och pålitlig kollektivtrafik innebär höga krav på IT. Tycker du om att arbeta med människor och vill du vara med och påverka? Då kan det här vara rätt möjlighet för dig!

Trafikförvaltningen är mitt i en omfattande digital transformation som drivs på av samhällsutvecklingen och branschens digitalisering. En viktig pusselbit i den digitala transformationen är att höja vår förmåga i att bli en mer datadriven organisation. För att lyckas med det är Data & Analys ett av våra stora fokusområden.

Vi söker nu en kommunikativ och pedagogisk strateg inom Data & Analys. Du stakar ut vägen framåt, dvs identifierar och etablerar förmågor inom Data & Analys i tätt samarbete med vår verksamhet och IT-avdelning. En central del i rollen handlar om att skapa förståelse och samsyn kring vilka möjligheter datadrivna insikter kan ge ur ett verksamhets- och affärsperspektiv.

Om rollen

Som Strateg inom Data & Analys har du en viktig roll i trafikförvaltningens satsning inom Data & Analys framåt. Avgörande för att bli framgångsrika är att skapa förståelse kring vikten och styrkan med datadrivna insikter, vilket förutsätter ett nära samarbete med ledare för olika förvaltningsområden på verksamhetssidan så väl som med IT-ledning och specialistteam inom IT.

Dina insikter kring viktiga förmågor, möjligheter och hinder samt erfarenheter av liknande resor har stor betydelse för oss.

I rollen som strateg kommer du att ansvara för att:


Leda strategisk inriktning och taktisk koordinering av fokusområdet Data & Analys
Stödja och möjliggöra exekvering av strategin för en datadriven organisation
Etablera och vidareutveckla förmågor inom data governance och data management
Säkerställa att områdets framtida lösningar och kommande utveckling drivs utifrån ett arkitektoniskt perspektiv och att målbilder är beslutade och ändamålsenliga
Säkerställa att kravställning på gemensamma plattformar och förmågor är tydligt kravställda och linjerade mot organisationens strategiska utveckling inom Data & Analys
Säkerställa att rätt kompetens och kapacitet finns för respektive förmågeområde


Vad vi söker

Då trafikförvaltningen är en organisation i förändring kräver rollen gedigen erfarenhet och kunskap om förändringsledning, strategiska dialoger och ställningstaganden. Stor vikt läggs på förmågan att samverka och kommunicera med ledningsgrupper och specialistgrupper inom både verksamhet och IT. Du har förmågan att förstå verksamhetens långsiktiga behov och kan omsätta till målbilder samt beskriva teknologins möjligheter och begräsningar, tex inom AI, automatisering och molnlösningar. Rollen förutsätter en tillräcklig teknisk kunskap som är relevant för området såsom best-of-breed-plattformar inom Data & Analys.

Vidare ser vi gärna att du har:


Tidigare chefserfarenhet
Kunskap och erfarenhet inom avancerad analys (AI)


Det är positivt om du har erfarenhet av arbete med organisations- och verksamhetsutveckling i en större/komplex organisation.

Vårt koncernspråk är svenska vilket ställer krav på att du talar och skriver svenska obehindrat.

Som person är du driven och engagerad i att leda och forma strategiska initiativ. Din självinsikt och förmåga att bygga relationer gör dig till en stark och pedagogisk kommunikatör som kan skapa förståelse och samförstånd i tvärfunktionella grupperingar och funktioner. Du har förmåga att skapa struktur och tydlighet i de förflyttningar du äger och driver samarbeten mot gemensamma mål och effekter.

Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Startdatum enligt överenskommelse.

Det här erbjuder vi dig

På trafikförvaltningen har du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas för ett helt yrkesliv. Här kan du vara expert och fokusera på ditt sakområde. Samtidigt som du jobbar i ett lag och i en organisation med stor bredd. Det finns stora möjligheter att röra sig mellan olika roller och uppgifter. Du har utrymme att forma din egen karriärväg och stärka både din personliga och professionella utveckling i en spännande och varierad miljö!

Vi är en välkomnande och öppen arbetsplats där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra. Vi vet att nyckeln för att vi ska klara vårt uppdrag – är medarbetare som trivs, mår bra och kan utvecklas på jobbet. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid att säkerställa hållbarhet i vårt arbetssätt, bland annat genom att erbjuda flexibilitet i vardagen och hybridarbete när möjlighet finns.

Årligen erbjuds hälsoundersökning och friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr. Hälsospåret, vår friskvårdssatsning, innehåller en rad olika hälsofrämjande aktiviteter. SL-kort är en annan uppskattad förmån hos oss. Läs mer om våra förmåner här .

Information och ansökan

I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Experis. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsulter Pia Boström, 0703 14 68 66 eller Anki Snis, 0703 77 59 69.

Vi använder tester för att säkra objektiva bedömningar. Ansökan sker via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via e-post. Endast CV önskas.

Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-08-23. Då vi går in i semestertider kommer kontakter och intervjuer ske tidigast vecka 32.

Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Webb och sociala medier

För mer information om hur det är att jobba hos oss, besök vår karriärsida . Du hittar oss också på LinkedIn .


Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer / Stockholm / 4 months / Start ASAP




Business Translator (Data & Analytics)




As a Business Translator you will be part of the Post Purchase Product Team reporting to the Engineering Lead. You will work with domain business analysts and experts to understands the strategic needs of the business, identify & structure opportunities that can be solved through data & analytics and you will be able to translate the need into possible new use cases in both business and technical language. Requiring close collaboration with architects, data & visualization engineers, Product Owners and subject matter experts/business analysts to establish the technical vision and evaluate trade offs between usability and performance requirements. The ideal candidate requires a passion for data, analytics & insights and understands the challenge of being a key part of the drive to being a data driven organisation. This requires excellent communication skills as well as being used to working in a cross functional environment.




Job responsibilities:




o Participate in various discovery workshops to understand the business objectives and goals

o Define minimum viable product (MVP) scope for the upcoming initiatives and outline future roadmap of enhancements and potential improvements

o Preparing functional to technical specifications, giving the needed instructions to the agile delivery team, testing the products results and ensuring a quality delivery according to the business requirements

o Drive the collaboration in development and rollout efforts for the new initiatives through the Data Architect, product teams, and actively engage in prototyping new solutions utilizing the clients Data Lake and Analytical solutions.

o Provide training and guidance to business key users and ensure successful adoption in day-to-day operations with final solution handover to support function




Experience and Skill Requirements:




• 5 years+ involvement in delivering Analytics projects

• Previous experience as functional consultant or an IT Business analyst with a well-rounded understanding for analytics, agile software development and business transformation.

• Practical experience in analytics development with Microsoft ADLS, Databricks, SQL, PowerBI & Qlik

• Excellent communicator with proven strong relationship building skills across varying levels of seniority

• Strong planning, communication and presentation skills

• Passionate about problem solving and solution design

• Forward-looking working style, ability to work in a team and a high level of commitment

• Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment




Language Requirements:




Fluent in English, other European languages are a benefit

Thank you in advance for your attention and continued support.

Show more

Experience and Skill Requirements:


• 5 years+ involvement in delivering Analytics projects

• Previous experience as functional consultant or an IT Business analyst with a well-rounded understanding for analytics, agile software development and business transformation.

• Practical experience in analytics development with Microsoft ADLS, Databricks, SQL, PowerBI & Qlik

• Excellent communicator with proven strong relationship building skills across varying levels of seniority

• Strong planning, communication and presentation skills

• Passionate about problem solving and solution design

• Forward-looking working style, ability to work in a team and a high level of commitment

• Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment


Language Requirements:


Fluent in English, other European languages are a benefit

Thank you in advance for your attention and continued support.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Company
PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.

We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.

We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.

Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.

Job Description Summary:
We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer who can design and maintain large scale data pipelines. An engineer who can identify, design, and implement solutions for optimizing data delivery.

Job Description:
Meet our team:

By joining Data Platform, you will be part of a great team powered by people from different regions of the world and working together on providing the best platform to collect, enrich and expose data for Zettle teams to make smarter and faster data-driven decisions.

Your way to impact:

On a more practical level, you will design and maintain large scale data pipelines. With that in mind, here you will get the opportunity to:


Play a role in building a new data pipeline on Google Cloud Platform.
Experiment fearlessly, take responsibilities, and grow your expertise to the next level.
Enable a data informed product development organization by delivering high quality data fast and easy to data users within the company.



In your day-to-day role:


You are interested in data modelling ensuring that timely updated, clean and accurate data is available to all teams at Zettle.
You are a true team player known for being reliable, curious and bold.
You gladly share your knowledge, experience and opinions while understanding and respecting that the last word comes from the team.
You make it fun and wouldn't mind playing OpenRA because that’s what we do as a team when we want to have fun.



What you need to bring:

In the Data Platform Team, we are mainly programming in Java and Python, while our stack also includes Kotlin, Airflow, Spark, Beam, BigQuery that is hosted on Google Cloud Platform. The infrastructure is defined in Terraform and we are using both continuous integration and deployment.


Working in cloud environments (GCP or AWS)
Strong software engineering fundamentals and backend development experience
Solid knowledge in an OOP language, preferably Java, Kotlin and Python
SQL and analytical databases such as BigQuery
Data processing frameworks such as Apache Beam
Airflow or other workflow management platforms



For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.

Our Benefits:

At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.

We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com

Who We Are:

To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx

Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.

Belonging at PayPal:

Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.

Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.

We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.

REQ ID R0113429

Title: Dataanalytiker DORA
Description:
Vi söker en duktig dataanalytiker till teamet som ansvarar för implementeringen av Digital Operational Resilience Act ("DORA") för vår kund inom banksektorn.

Teamets ansvarsområden kommer att sträcka sig över flera nyckelområden, inklusive insamling av affärs- och funktionskrav, inklusive sourcing, kartläggning, profilering och modellering av data, samt utveckling av en datahubb/repository. Dessutom kommer teamet att ha till uppgift att skapa en automatiserad ETL-process och en rapporteringsmotor och mekanism för att uppfylla DORA-kraven.

Att gå med i Sii Sweden innebär att få tillgång till förmånerna hos ett erfaret IT-konsultföretag. Vi erbjuder ett omfattande kompensationspaket som inkluderar försäkringar, pensionsplaner och friskvårdsförmåner, från utbildningssessioner och webbseminarier till gemensamma kunskapsdelningssessioner med kollegor. Trivs i vår stabila och framåtblickande miljö, där din tillväxt och framgång är våra prioriteringar.

Vi ser fram emot att ha dig ombord!







Du kommer att:

Bygga upp informationsregistret på enhets-, delkonsoliderad och konsoliderad nivå i enlighet med Digital Operational Resilience Act
Samla in data från olika källor, skapa datamodeller, utforma och skriva ETL-skript och generera detaljerade rapporter
Implementera tekniska standarder på standardmallarna för informationsregistret i samband med alla avtalsarrangemang för användning av ICT-tjänster
Planera och schemalägga intervjuer med kundens applikationsägare och leverantörer för att identifiera DORA-databehov
Analysera kraven på DORA-data
Proaktivt planera och driva kravarbetet med ROI:s nyckelintressenter, framtida ROI-applikationsägare och leverantörer
Utforma användningsfall




Vi hoppas att du har:

Kunskaper i Python och/eller R för dataanalys och visualisering
Utforma och skriva ETL-skript
Bra kunskaper i SQL för att göra sökningar och hantera databaser
Erfarenhet av verktyg som Tableau, Power BI eller QlikView
Expertis inom rengöring, omvandling och förberedelse av data för analys
Kännedom om DORA-bestämmelser
Erfarenhet av att arbeta effektivt inom tvärfunktionella team




Show more

Title: Data Engineer to Data-Move
Description:
We are looking for a Data Engineer for our client project. It s a growing System Engineering and Solution Company, that offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web Application Development, Cloud & DevOps Technologies, Testing Services, Consultancy, and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model.

Location: EU (Ready to travel to Stockholm 1-2 weeks a month)

Start Date: ASAP

Rate: 40 - 43 eur/hour

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain SADP and IDPs to ensure high-quality data.
Implement data mesh capabilities as part of the One Data Foundation Initiative.
Manage other priority initiatives, including but not limited to BTI-292, BTI-146, BTI-147, and BTI-260.



Technical Skills:


Extensive experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP), including a thorough understanding of various Google services, their appropriate use, and cost implications.
Strong knowledge of data warehouse concepts and SQL.
Proficiency in Python, DBT, and Terraform.



Preferred Qualifications:


Cloud certifications will be considered a plus.



Additional Information:


The candidate must be willing to travel to Stockholm for 1-2 weeks each month.



Location: EU (Ready to travel to Stockholm 1-2 weeks a month)

Start Date: ASAP

Rate: 40 - 43 eur/hour

If you meet the qualifications and are interested in this position, please apply as soon as possible.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
About Redeploy Insight

At Redeploy Insight, we specialize in building modern cloud data platforms to serve clients across the Nordics to enable enterprise-scale analytical capabilities. Our core focus lies in delivering cutting-edge solutions, including consulting expertise, managed services, and SaaS Data & AI platforms. We take pride in our strategic partnerships with industry leaders such as Microsoft & Databricks, positioning ourselves at the forefront of technological innovation.

Redeploy Insight has successfully delivered large-scale and innovative data platforms to Electrolux, Coop, Folksam, PostNord, and Handelsbanken to name a few. Our dedicated team is passionate about enabling enterprise-scale analytical capabilities, empowering our clients to gain profound insights and make informed, impactful decisions.

The demand for cloud based analytical platforms is constantly growing and we are now looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing team in Stockholm or Gothenburg. You will work in a fast-paced environment where you will collaborate with some of the most brilliant minds in the field and contribute to the evolution of our platforms with your expertise Data Engineering.

About The Role

As a Data Engineer in our backend team, you will help to ensure that data pipelines and data stores are high-performing, efficient, organized, and reliable, given a specific set of business requirements and constraints. You will deal with unanticipated issues swiftly and minimize data loss. You will also design, implement, monitor, and optimize data platforms to meet the data pipeline needs.

In this role we see that you have knowledge of data processing languages, such as SQL, or Python, and an understanding of parallel processing and data architecture patterns.

To be considered for the role, we see that you come with the following experiences and skills:


University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering.
1-3 years of experience as Data Engineer or similar role
Familiar with Microsoft Azure Data lake, Databricks, SQL database and data warehouse solutions.
Experience in designing, implementing, and supporting enterprise-scale ETL / ELT pipelines.
Ability to integrate data from a variety of sources using integration and orchestration tools (e.g. Azure Data Factory).
Fluency in Swedish and English with good communication skills.


You are


A Social team-player with drive and positive attitude
Analytical, communicative, and driven
A flexible person with “Can-do mentality”
Experienced in planning and executing in your projects


You would like to work with us if you


Want to work with the latest technology and projects within in Analytics and AI
Are motivated by customer challenges
Like to work in teams and are humble
Want to be in a workplace where your thoughts are valued, and your ideas make an impact


How To Apply

If you're ready to launch your career and make a meaningful impact on organizations through your passion for Data Engineering, then don’t hesitate to send in your application by hitting the apply button.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Note: To be eligible for the role you need to be based in Stockholm or Gothenburg, or have plans to relocate to either of the locations.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
⚡️ What We Do

Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden’s industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.

With industry-leading AI software at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.

🌟The Team

We're committed to shaping tomorrow's energy system with flexible power at its core. Our ambitious team shares a common goal, working together to create a sustainable future. We are now looking for a passionate and skilled Data Engineer based in Stockholm to fulfill that goal with us.

👩‍💻 About The Role

We are looking for a passionate, self-driven and dedicated Data Engineer to join our Implementation and Operations team. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and systems that power our data-driven solutions. You will also work closely with our Data Scientists from the Trading Strategy and Modeling team. Your work will contribute to the development and maintenance of an important stage in our solutions, by making sure that the data travels seamlessly from end to end in our pipelines.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and maintain scalable, robust, and efficient data pipelines
Build and optimize data ingestion and processing systems for structured and unstructured data
Work with the data science team to maintain data models and build and maintain MLOps and ETL pipelines
Implement and maintain data quality checks, validation, and monitoring
Create and maintain CI/CD pipelines in GitHub and AWS
Build and maintain data lake and storage solutions
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and develop data-driven solutions
Design and implement data security and privacy controls
Create and maintain documentation of data pipelines, processes, and procedures


Qualifications


3+ years of experience as a Data Engineer or similar role
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL
Familiarity with DevOps practices such as Docker, CI/CD, git, testing
Familiarity with cloud data services, preferably from AWS, such as Lambda
Understanding of data modeling, data storage, and database design
Knowledge of data security and privacy regulations and best practices


📍 Location

We value office collaboration but support some hybrid work. Our office is at Söder Mälarstrand, minutes away from Gamla Stan subway station in Stockholm.

🛒 Apply

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and why you feel you would be a great addition to our team. In the recruitment process you will meet with the Talent Acquisition Specialist, Engineering Team, Hiring Manager and the CEO.

Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office, so we want you to submit your CV in English.

We look forward to hearing from you!

We value office collaboration but support some hybrid work. Our office is at Söder Mälarstrand, minutes away from Gamla Stan subway station in Stockholm.

🛒 Apply

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and why you feel you would be a great addition to our team. In the recruitment process you will meet with the Talent Acquisition Specialist, Engineering Team, Hiring Manager and the CEO.

Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office, so we want you to submit your CV in English.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
What We Do At Qliro

At Qliro we deliver safe and simple payments. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants who serve their customers every day. We believe that if our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly and highly competent people that together have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey of scaling our business both here in Sweden and the Nordics.

What Your Team Does

We're a data team responsible for the data platform that powers Qliro's Analytics and data producs, handling over 50 TB of data! We believe great work can be done anywhere, that's why we offer flexible remote work. Join us and leverage your data expertise to build high-impact data products that fuel business decisions and power our machine learning models serving millions of customers.

How you'll make a difference:


Wrangle massive datasets related to Payments.
Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for efficient data flow.
Champion data quality and ensure its accuracy for critical business decisions.
Utilize cutting-edge tools like AWS, Snowflake, GitLab, and dbt to build a robust data platform.
Partner with cross-functional teams (Product, Finance, Credit and Tech teams) to translate data into data products and building the foundation for Analytics.


What You Bring To The Team


You are highly experienced in the majority of our techstack, but most importantly in SQL, Python, dbt and Snowflake (or similar cloud data warehouse)
You bring value to the business by using data, preferably within financial and/or related industries
You are logical and analytical minded and are able to communicate technical content to end users
Passionate about solving complex business problems by building data products with high quality and velocity
You are someone who continuously seeks improvements, enjoys learning new tools and techniques and having fun together as a data team.


Our stack:

Snowflake, dbt, Airflow, Docker, AWS & Tableau

Does this sound like your next role? What are you waiting for - apply now!
Show more

Title: Analyst Consultant - Risk Analytics
Description:
Who You'll Work With

You’ll join our global Risk & Resilience Practice in one of our European offices and be part of the Risk Analytics team. 

Risk Analytics is the tech-enablement power engine of Risk & Resilience. We combine deep analytical and technical expertise with distinctive strategy and transformation capabilities to support clients in everything - from large-scale analytics programs to in-depth technical modelling exercises.

We develop and deploy leading-edge solutions incorporating the latest innovations in methodology and technology and maintain in-depth knowledge of regulatory developments. We convene leaders in the industry to build and share knowledge to drive long-term sustainable change in the practice of risk data and analytics.

We have over 18 years of expertise serving leading institutions across industries in the fields of model development, model advisory, model validation, and model risk management.

We are a diverse global community of world-class practitioners with a shared passion to build risk analytics capabilities that break new ground, transform industries, and shape markets. We solve real life business problems for our clients; work with us and you will learn from the best and have your voice heard from day one.

There is flexibility to hire at the Analyst or Senior Analyst level depending on candidate experience.

What You'll Do

As an Analyst Consultant in Risk Analytics, you will


Help clients to develop, refine and review their models using cutting-edge technology to better manage risk, assess market opportunities and create business benefits, across different areas of expertise.
Assess our clients’ frameworks for model development and risk management across a variety of risk topics. This includes credit risk, market and trading risk, climate risk, financial crime and compliance and wider applications such as cyber and digital trust.
Analyze content and data, identify risk vectors, build prototypes, interpret results, find new solutions, derive conclusions, support clients to implement recommendations, and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value.
Be expected to communicate complex analytics concepts in a clear and concise manner to key client stakeholders 
Be able to establish connections between sophisticated modelling techniques and strategic decision-making processes. You will have exposure to a highly international environment as our client base is global 
Work on projects and exchange experiences with your colleagues which means you will face new intellectual challenges daily, while continuously building your methodological knowledge and skills, as well as your strategic consultancy toolkit


RiskandR

Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree required. Advanced quantitative degree (Masters or Ph.D. in computer science, mathematics/statistics, engineering, or financial engineering) would be a plus
2+ years of relevant experience in risk quantitative analysis/modelling to solve real world problems  
Experience across model lifecycle, including active participation in activities of development, implementation and/or testing of risk models (vendor or “in-house” models) 
First experience in programming (beyond simple scripts) in a modern scientific language (e.g., Python, Matlab, R). Knowledge of SQL, NoSQL (e.g. MongoDB, Ignite) and SAS would be a strong plus 
Experience in one of the following machine learning / AI areas natural language processing, deep learning, anomaly detection, graph-based techniques would be a strong plus 
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization 
Exceptional communication skills - especially around translating technical knowledge into forms that can be digested by leadership and non-technical project teams-, verbally and in writing, in English and the local office language(s) 
Willingness to travel 
Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Did you know that we have 500 million online visitors every year? Join our Data & ML Platform team and help promote a more data-driven development!




Do you want to help us leverage the data from our 40M visits a month? Join our data journey and have an impact on Sweden's largest property portal. We need you to help us complete the transition from our current Data Warehouse into our new, full-fledged Data Platform. And then take it to the next level.




Hemnet is the largest property portal in Sweden, and as such, we handle vast amounts of data and events related to the use of our website and apps. We believe that we have only scratched the surface when it comes to turning this data into new products and analyses, for user and market benefit.




We are on an exciting journey to build a new Data Platform. We have several interesting challenges ahead of us before the new Data Platform is ready to serve all the data and events generated in the system, and cater to all of Hemnet’s needs for analytics, statistics, and all our data-driven product features. The main goals of the Data Platform are: All data in one place, and unified tracking.




Technology that we use includes AWS & GCP, Airbyte, BigQuery, dbt, and server-side GTM.




We see the need to strengthen our team of Data Engineers. We are now looking for a seasoned Data Engineer with solid knowledge from working with large amounts of data and events, building aggregation pipelines, and serving data to products and users from a Data Warehouse or a Data Platform.




The Data Engineers at Hemnet are part of the Data and ML Platform team, which has an overall responsibility for supporting the whole organization with stable and performant platforms for data and MLOps, as well as development and training of ML models. We see great opportunities ahead leveraging our vast data sources to both broaden and deepen our analytics department, and to build new data-driven products to serve our customers.




What we offer

We have a beautiful office next to Hötorget and a hybrid-remote work setup (not fully remote), offering flexibility and balance. Enjoy 30 days of holiday plus 4 YOLO days, paid workouts, running classes/races, and flexible working hours. We provide comprehensive benefits to ensure you feel safe and supported, including pension benefits, parental leave top-up, and health insurance. Here’s our full benefit package 👈.




Our culture of sharing includes lab weeks twice a year, Friday demos, dev brekkies, and brown bags. Hemnet is a place where you can be yourself and have fun with others. We actively encourage you to explore and share your other passions – whether it's producing music, painting, or playing with clay.




Join us in crafting digital products that make a real impact!

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Join us in creating world-class creativity apps used by millions of people.




Appostrophe is a mobile app development company creating easy-to-use design tools that unlock people's creativity. Our portfolio consists of top-listed apps such as SCRL, Memo, Text Art, and Add Text that are used and loved by millions of people worldwide. We’re a small, ambitious team that enjoys working together in central Stockholm and are looking for more like-minded people to join our mission.




We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join the analytics team that handles the data and analysis of an app portfolio with millions of monthly users.




What you will do

Be responsible for our ETL system, guaranteeing its ease of use, reliability, and error reporting capabilities.
Establish data retrieval processes to collect data from the services we use through API calls.
Support with creation of internal libraries to help with app metrics calculations.
Bring to production data scientists’ models so that they can be accessed easily by the team.
Handle backend topics such as notifications messaging for in-app promotions.
Shape the development of our technologies aimed at the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data and metrics calculation.
Be a beacon and an evangelist of data culture throughout the company.




You should have

IT knowledge. You have excellent knowledge of Python, SQL and NodeJS or other languages used for data engineering.
Data pipelines owner. You know how to fully manage data pipelines from data ingestions to processing in the most efficient way.
Interest in our industry. You have experience or a strong interest in the subscription app business and you want to use your knowledge of data engineering to support Appostrophe in its mission to create the most amazing apps for its customers.
Good communication skills. You are able to communicate insights, strategies, and results clearly and effectively to the team. You can make complex topics you manage easy to understand.
Quality and pragmatism. You are able to work at a high pace without compromising quality.
Can-do attitude. You are a self-motivated problem solver with an eye for details and an internal drive for excellence.




We offer

Opportunity to be creative and test new ideas.
Important role in a successful startup.
Great colleagues and office in central Stockholm.
Competitive salary.




Show more

Description:
Are you ready to face new challenges in the dynamic fields of Data Protection and Cybersecurity? We have exciting opportunities awaiting you! Whether you´re seeking your next career move or eager to explore new possibilities, we´re here to help you succeed.




Express Your Interest:

Are you interested in GDPR, DORA, or other data security measures? Let us know! Your application indicates your interest in relevant projects that match your skills. This role emphasizes implementation rather than deep technical expertise.

Partnering with Top Companies:

We connect talent with some of Sweden´s leading companies in Data Protection and Cybersecurity. Join our network to unlock endless possibilities for growth and success.

Data Protection Officer (DPO)

Cybersecurity Analyst
Data Privacy Consultant
Cloud Security Specialist

Risk and Compliance Manager
Incident Response Specialist
Security Architect
IT Auditor
Information Security Consultant
Security Awareness Trainer
Industrial Control Systems (ICS) Security Specialist
Threat Intelligence Analyst
And many more!




Apply Now:

Ready to take the next step in your Data Protection and Cybersecurity career? Submit your resume today, and we´ll reach out to you as soon as a matching project comes along.
