Title: Associate Data Analyst, Revenue
Description:
We’re looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Data Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you’ll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You’ll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more. 




What you’ll do
You’ll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10’s of billions of data points per day!!)
You’ll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, helping us understand how to improve and optimise our members experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in SQL, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation in a range of areas such as revenue management, operations and strategy. For instance, you could work on testing and validating pricing and promotion based opportunities across our portfolio of apps. 
You will make contributions to the data model and could contribute to building out data pipelines
You’ll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, operations managers, and Data Engineers PLUS, you’ll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc







You are a data analyst with expertise in SQL, data visualisation, A/B testing, statistical knowledge and storytelling, etc, is entrepreneurial, gets excited about building from scratch, and is relentlessly experimenting in pursuit of building a product that members love. You have confidence in the following:
Supporting experimentation analytics (e.g. A/B testing, user group testing): significance analysis, non-parametric methods, bootstrapping, causal inference
Manipulating complex datasets using a range of tools such as SQL and Hive
Building effective self serve tools and visualisations to help optimise decision making
Engaging and collaborating with key stakeholders such as developers, product managers, and senior management
Identifying issues and opportunities, translating business problems into analytical diagnoses and delivering insights that answer the most pressing questions
Supporting engineers and teammates in improving data quality, and specifying requirements for new data collection
Partnering with the wider analytics / data science team to solve business problems
Experience in Python is desirable but not required
Experience with data modelling and make domain-specific data models is a plus

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:

A leading company in the CBD industry is seeking a passionate and motivated Junior Data Analyst to join their innovative team in Central London. This organisation is dedicated to delivering comprehensive CBD products and services, emphasizing sustainable, natural, and organic solutions.




Key Responsibilities:

Market Research: Conduct thorough market research to gather and analyze data on industry trends, consumer behavior, and competitive landscape.
Data Analytics: Perform data collection, cleansing, and analysis to generate actionable insights. Utilize statistical tools and software to interpret complex data sets.
Direct Reporting: Act as a direct report to senior team members, providing accurate and timely data analysis and insights.
Presentation Work: Prepare and deliver clear, concise, and compelling presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, R, Python, or SQL.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Detail-oriented with strong organisational skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
Prior experience in market research or data analytics is a plus.




This position would suit someone who is a recent graduate from a top-tier university with an environmental data background. To apply for this position, please apply with your most up to date CV.

  • Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Economics, Business, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, R, Python, or SQL.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.
  • Detail-oriented with strong organisational skills.
  • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a hybrid work environment.
  • Prior experience in market research or data analytics is a plus.


This position would suit someone who is a recent graduate from a top-tier university with an environmental data background. To apply for this position, please apply with your most up to date CV.

Title: Data Analyst (Python)
Description:
About the Company: A great opportunity to join a highly ambitious, London-based, food & drink consultancy on a mission to support our customers with expert data insight. They are one of the leading consultancies in the food and drinks industry, and provide expert consultancy through data and insight, powered by analytical thinking, outstanding expertise, and insights technology. They work with a broad range of clients emerging brands and operators and some of the most renowned businesses.




About the Role: They are looking for a Data Analyst confident in Python, SQL and GitHub to join their growing data team, this is more than a standard data role.




Responsibilities:

Restructure and maintain data into a database-friendly multi-table format for all product trackers and bespoke research.
Implement systems to help the optimization of data efficiency and data quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources to enrich internal data.
Assist in the identification, design, development, and maintenance of new and existing data tools and applications.
Troubleshooting databases and BI tools to ensure minimal client disruption.
Set up and maintenance of automated data processes.
KPI tracking
Analysing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.




Qualifications:

Previous experience working with survey data
Working experience in Python and GitHub a non negotiable
Strong understanding of relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server).
Advanced Excel data handling and modelling.
Analytical and problem-solving skills to spot trends, errors and highlight / rectify.
Understand the process of acquiring, cleansing, and transforming data.
Dashboard building
Web analytics and behavioural tracking (i.e., Google Analytics)




Pay range and compensation package:35k-37k

Hybrid: 2 x days in London a week

Title: Data Analysis
Description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.​




About the job you’re considering

• Inputting to the T1POSx Balance Scorecard and producing relevant report.

- Updating T1POSx Balanced Scorecard

- Prepare T1POSx reports and analysis. e.g.: Tash needs for this month a report of all One Sat suppliers with their OTD.

- Facilitate T1POSx governance execution

- Monitor routine of performance with T1POSx colleagues: eg: ensure and guide people update ZEST_PO, NC declaration.




• Data repository and reporting mapping.

- Map all SPOT systems and use of g-sheets. To record data for reporting use.

- Map all outputs (reports, presentations)




• OES T1POS Masterplan management.

- Create tasks in the Masterplan

- Allocate ownership to the task.

- Track progress of the task.




• SMP updates for Risk Management

- Create risks in SMP.

- Automate the generation of risks from SMP to ARM (in line with the agreed criteria for escalation)




• Onsite assessment of key subcontractor Oerlikon

- Service provider to attend Oerlikon site in Barleben once per week until site closure varying day of attendance weekly.

- Tour shop floor and complete checklist as provided by ADS, looking at progress to plan and changes in environment.

- When NCs are raised by the supplier, the attendee shall verify the implementation of the containment and corrective action as requested by ADS.

- Prepare and deliver reports and debrief to ADS.




This role is based on site in Portsmouth - 5 days a week.




Your role

Skills and experience







• In depth experience of SAP

• In depth experience using an MRP/ERP tool

• Excellent communication skills

• Google workspace knowledge essential

• Supplier management

• Reporting to external and internal customers

• Confident to communicate clearly to all stakeholders.

• Able to work in a demanding environment.

• Project management







Don’t meet every single requirements? Studies have shown women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every requirement in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway.​




You can bring your whole self to work. At Capgemini, stiving for equity, diversity and inclusion is part of everyday life, and will be part of your working reality. We have built an inclusive and welcoming environment, for everyone.




Your security clearance

To be successfully appointed to this role, it is a requirement to obtain Security Check (SC) clearance. ​




To obtain SC clearance, the successful applicant must have resided continuously within the United Kingdom for the last 5 years, along with other criteria and requirements.​




Throughout the recruitment process, you will be asked questions about your security clearance eligibility such as, but not limited to, country of residence and nationality.​




Some posts are restricted to sole UK Nationals for security reasons; therefore, you may be asked about your citizenship in the application process.​




What does ‘Get The Future You Want ‘ mean for you?

You will be encouraged to have a positive work-life balance. Our hybrid-first way of working means we embed hybrid working in all that we do and make flexible working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. All UK employees are eligible to request flexible working arrangements. You’d be joining an accredited Great Place to work for Wellbeing in 2023. Employee wellbeing is vitally important to us as an organisation. We see a healthy and happy workforce a critical component for us to achieve our organisational ambitions. ​




To help support wellbeing we have trained ‘Mental Health Champions’ across each of our business areas, and we have invested in wellbeing apps such as Thrive and Peppy. You will reimagine what’s possible: creating value for the world’s leading organisations through technology to build a sustainable, more inclusive future. You will work with a range of clients all with a unique set of business, technological and societal ambitions, which will make a real impact across the UK.




Why you should consider Capgemini

Growing clients’ businesses while building a more sustainable, more inclusive future is a tough ask. But when you join Capgemini, you join a thriving company and become part of a diverse collective of free-thinkers, entrepreneurs and industry experts. A powerful source of energy that drives us all to find new ways technology can help us reimagine what’s possible. It’s why, together, we seek out opportunities that will transform the world’s leading businesses. And it’s how you’ll gain the experiences and connections you need to shape your future. By learning from each other every day, sharing knowledge and always pushing yourself to do better, you’ll build the skills you want. And you’ll use them to help our clients leverage technology to grow their business and give innovation that human touch the world needs. So, it might not always be easy, but making the world a better place rarely is.




About Capgemini

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.​




​




Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com​




​




At Capgemini Engineering we value excellence, care, responsibility, dynamism and innovation. We offer a job with variation that leaves plenty of room for initiative and development. In fact, we are not just offering you a job, we’re inviting you to be part of our community where we will provide you trainings, tools & grounds for professional and personal growth. Each career experience is assorted by an attractive salary package.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us…




Centaur Media is a main market listed company, primarily based in the UK with approximately 300 employees in offices in Central London.




Part of Centaur Media PLC, Xeim exists to accelerate performance for marketers. The Xeim portfolio brings together some of the world’s leading marketing brands to deliver best practice business information, thought leadership and specialist consultancy. Xeim includes the brands Marketing Week, Festival of Marketing, Econsultancy, Oystercatchers, Creative Review, Design Week, Really B2B and Influencer Intelligence.




Through these market leading brands, we engage the marketing industry with over 6.2 million touchpoints per month across proprietary editorial content, digital products, insight and analysis. We know that by advising, informing and connecting the modern marketer with these disciplines, excellence in marketing and business performance will be achieved.




Another part of Centaur Media is The Lawyer. With 30 years’ experience under our belt, The Lawyer is the longest running UK legal news and information brand.







About the role....




The position plays a crucial role in utilising data to drive decision-making, optimize performance, and enhance the audience experience within our organisation. The role holder will be a subject expert on data, implementation and best practice identifying patterns, trends, and insights that will inform strategic decisions.




The position sits within the central Data team and operates across all Xeim and The Lawyer brands at Centaur. Centaur is currently a hybrid working environment, with a minimum of one day per week for project catch-ups in the Waterloo office







Responsibilities....




Technical Expertise




Use data mining to extract information from data sets and identify correlations and patterns
Organise and transform information into comprehensible structures
Use data to predict trends in the customer base and the consumer population as a whole
Perform statistical analysis of data
Use tools and techniques to visualise data in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphs
Prepare reports and present these to internal stakeholders
Monitor data quality and remove corrupt data
Communicate with internal stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements




Product Expertise




Maintain up-to-date knowledge of developments and capabilities across the business
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of technology developments within the IT/digital industry, specifically around data and data warehousing




Relationship Management




Develop & maintain relationships with
Digital, Data & IT team
Key internal brand stakeholders
Digital individuals and teams across the wider business










What we need from you...




Skills:




Strong SQL and data manipulation skills, with deep knowledge of relevant relational databases
A solid understanding of data sources, data organisation and storage
In-depth knowledge of statistical methodologies and data analysis techniques
Strong experience in understanding of reporting and data visualisation tools such as Business Objects, PowerBI and Tableau
Understanding of ETL framework and ETL tools including dbt and Microsoft SSIS
Detail oriented and analytical mind with problem solving capabilities







Competencies:




Strong communication
Team working
Complex stakeholder management
Pragmatic approach to problem solving
Analytical thinking
Strong documentational skills







Experience:




Demonstrable experience in data analytics, statistics, statistical methodologies and data analysis techniques, or related disciplines
Strong problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and the capacity to analyse large datasets and draw meaningful insights
The ability to effectively communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders, both in writing and verbally
Proven expertise in data manipulation concepts, structures, and technology
Experience managing multiple projects with competing deadlines, prioritizing tasks, and collaborating with cross-functional teams
Appreciation of working across a diverse stack










The benefits….




25 days holiday, increasing by one day p.a. to a maximum of 30 days for every year served
Medicash health plan and discount gym membership
Stunning Waterloo offices with views of the Thames plus complimentary barista coffee / free bar / table tennis tables – the works
Complimentary access to accredited training programmes worth thousands of pounds including our Mini MBA
Competitive pension scheme
Active Diversity and Inclusivity agenda (DICE – Diversity, Inclusion, Culture, Engagement)
Annual Wellness Day
Share Incentive Plan

  • Appreciation of working across a diverse stack

  • Medicash health plan and discount gym membership

  • Complimentary access to accredited training programmes worth thousands of pounds including our Mini MBA
  • Competitive pension scheme
  • Active Diversity and Inclusivity agenda (DICE – Diversity, Inclusion, Culture, Engagement)
  • Annual Wellness Day

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analysts Role




I’m excited to share an opportunity with a market-leading HealthTech company.




This innovative company delivers cutting-edge health programs backed by advanced technology and clinical expertise. Their products have hugely positive impact on millions of employees across the UK and offers the chance for a Data Analyst to have real impact in a rapidly growing organisation, with huge career growth potential!




Must haves..




Data Analysis tools: Power BI, SQL,

Data Sources: Azure SQL

Policy: Fully remote with very occasional trips to London

Interview Process: A simple two stage process!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Purpose

At Travelex, data is at the heart of our relationship with our customers. We analyse data in order to understand what our customers prefer and how our products perform. Our work is fast-paced although our team remains collaborative and flexible even when delivering fast.

Your role as data analyst will be to run a wide range of queries on our datasets, interpret the results, and communicate your findings to colleagues and stakeholders. You will be working with product owners, subject matter experts, managers and engineers across the company to develop deep insight on our customers and products.

You will have an end-to-end responsibility for your deliverables: from leading the work to agree the right approach, through developing, running and continuously refining your queries, all the way to presenting your results and recommending what the business should do about them. You will have significant impact on the way our business evolves, and a high level of freedom to do things in your own way.




Responsibilities

Here are key things you’ll do as a data analyst in our team. The list isn’t complete: as a competent analyst, you’ll bring to Travelex your own ideas of what else is needed to become a world-class data-driven business.

Work with colleagues to understand their analytical needs and convert these into robust analytical tasks
Explore data in a range of business domains, such as: retail customer behaviour; online customer behaviour; payment cards; product performance; colleague performance; HR; finance, cost and pricing
Analyse data to understand trends, gaps and anomalies
Build time series, models and forecasts
Compare the performance of products, campaigns and sales across the different geographies where Travelex operates
Help automate analytical tasks so that powerful analytics can come with little effort
Present your findings in a simple, compelling and inspiring way
Develop visualisations and infographics that will shed light on complex business questions
Derive metrics from data and build the processes to monitor these metrics over time
Have particular responsibility for data quality: defining it, monitoring it and improving it




Key Requirements

This vacancy is for someone who greatly enjoys problem-solving, simplifying complex data into simple insight, and continuous learning. Below are key requirements from our data analyst, but you don’t need to tick every box: success in our team comes in many forms!

Competent in analysing data using SQL and Python
Familiar with AWS, including databases, data services and analytics capabilities
Experienced with SageMaker
Capable of creating engaging visualisations and infographics
A strong storyteller, who can turn a big pile of numbers into an interesting narrative
Self-starter and independent, able to turn loosely-defined requirements into concrete deliverables by asking questions, taking initiative and recommending a way forward
A good team player, who enjoys brainstorming and engaging, and is able to resolve differences of opinion in a constructive way
Understands the foundations of information security and data protection
Able to learn new tools, languages and methods quickly
Have the curiosity to understand the business, its requirements and culture
Knowledge of visualisation tools (e.g. Amazon QuickSight) and data modelling techniques isn’t essential but would be an advantage
Familiarity with DBT would be an advantage
Experience of building machine learning models, and familiarity with the common ML libraries in Python, would be an advantage
Your own unique style or way of working, which will make our team diverse and original




Why Travelex?

To remain the world’s leading Foreign Exchange specialist, we focus on making our customers’ lives hassle-free while they travel.

We are customer-centric and innovative. Our digital and data products are part of our investment in the future of Foreign Exchange, cross-border e-commerce and international payments.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Why Travelex?

To remain the world’s leading Foreign Exchange specialist, we focus on making our customers’ lives hassle-free while they travel.

We are customer-centric and innovative. Our digital and data products are part of our investment in the future of Foreign Exchange, cross-border e-commerce and international payments.

  • We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why work for us?

A career at Janus Henderson is more than a job, it’s about investing in a brighter future together.

Our Mission at Janus Henderson is to help clients define and achieve superior financial outcomes through differentiated insights, disciplined investments, and world-class service. We will do this by protecting and growing our core business, amplifying our strengths, and diversifying where we have the right.

Our Values are key to driving our success, and are at the heart of everything we do:

Clients Come First - Always | Execution Supersedes Intention | Together We Win | Diversity Improves Results | Truth Builds Trust

If our mission, values, and purpose align with your own, we would love to hear from you!

Your opportunity

To join the Investment Data Strategy & Solutions Team - tasked with leading the data analysis on the components of strategic projects associated with the investment community
The Investment Data Strategy & Solutions Team is part of the Investment Management Chief Operating Officer Office (IM COO) working within Investment Management
Identify and analyse data attributes within JHI (Janus Henderson International) systems and document the impact proposed by change through projects or initiatives
Create functional requirements documents detailing current state and proposed changes and be able to clearly articulate these to impacted teams
Liaise with Technology teams, clearly communicating the development changes required for delivery and overseeing testing and sign off with business users
Generate appropriate business requirements, documents, workflows, and process maps
Analyse the usage of core and non-core data, identify opportunities to optimise or align with strategic solutions
Work with centralised Data Management teams to ensure that efforts in the Investment Management community work in synergy with those teams
Creation of repeatable data testing frameworks to ensure requirements built to your specification meet the necessary standards
Facilitate requirements gathering meetings
Leverage emerging technology and techniques to achieve your work goals in a timely manner
Liaise with stakeholders and ensure regular communications with the business, technology, and data teams
Collaborate with Data Architects to ensure all change is clearly documented by updating of conceptual and logical models and ensuring data catalogues, definitions and lineage is all aligned
Carry out other duties as assigned

What to expect when you join our firm

Hybrid working and reasonable accommodations
Generous Holiday policies
Excellent Health and Wellbeing benefits including corporate membership to ClassPass
Paid volunteer time to step away from your desk and into the community
Support to grow through professional development courses, tuition/qualification reimbursement and more
All-inclusive approach to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
Maternal/paternal leave benefits and family services
Complimentary subscription to Headspace – the mindfulness app
All employee events including networking opportunities and social activities
Lunch allowance for use within our subsidised onsite canteen

Must have skills

Experience of working on large scale data transformation projects in a Technical Business Analyst or Data Analyst role
Experience of working within a data team or dealing with processing large amounts of data
Experience does not need to be in the Asset Management industry
Experience writing & implementing business requirements, process maps, and user stories.
Good stakeholder management skills
Strong Microsoft Excel skills
Strong SQL & Python (Pandas) skills
Experience with process mapping software applications: Visio, Lucid Charts etc.
Strong technical aptitude
Analytical, structured, and logical in approach
Attention to detail and a delivery focused mind set
Organised & collaborative

Nice to have skills

Business knowledge: Asset Management, Equity, Fixed Income, OTC and Exchange Traded Derivatives, Fund Management, Security Analytics, Client Reporting, Performance Measurement and Regulatory reporting
Previous finance experience, especially middle and back-office processes
‘Big data’ analysis experience preferred
Methodologies: Agile
Machine Learning skills preferred
Systems: Charles River Development, S&P EDM (formerly CADIS), EAGLE
Scientific, Mathematical or Computer Science degree or equivalent

Supervisory responsibilities

No

Potential for growth

Mentoring
Leadership development programs
Regular training
Career development services
Continuing education courses

You will be expected to understand the regulatory obligations of the firm, and abide by the regulated entity requirements and JHI policies applicable for your role.

At Janus Henderson Investors we’re committed to an inclusive and supportive environment. We believe diversity improves results and we welcome applications from all backgrounds. Don’t worry if you don’t think you tick every box, we still want to hear from you! We understand everyone has different commitments and while we can’t accommodate every flexible working request we’re happy to be asked about work flexibility and our hybrid working environment. If you need any reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process, please get in touch and let us know at recruiter@janushenderson.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Durham | Utilities | £35,000 - £43,000




Peaple Talent have partnered exclusively with a leading Utilities provider, who are at the forefront of providing innovative and sustainable utility solutions. They are committed to optimizing resource management, ensuring high-quality service, and driving impactful data-driven decisions. Join the dynamic team and contribute to their mission of making utilities smarter and more efficient.




Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join the team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, with specific experience using Power BI to drive business insights and decision-making. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing complex data sets, creating visually compelling reports, and providing actionable insights to support our strategic goals.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Gather requirements, design solutions and work with stakeholders on their delivery.
Act as business partner for Data Analytics to other teams as required.
Provide regular project/progress reports and resource plans.




Experience needed:

SQL, Advanced Excel.
Advanced skills using Power BI,
Knowledge of SSRS or other BI/Reporting tools.
Organised and reliable with attention to detail.
Bonus points for experience in Development of data models and warehouses.




What We Offer:

💰Salary: £35,000-£43,000

📈Opportunities for professional growth and development.

🤝A collaborative and innovative work environment.

♻️The chance to make a meaningful impact in the utilities industry.

🪙10% matched Pension

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Product Analyst

£60,000

London (1 or 2 days p/w)




I've partnered with a business intelligence business that work in the Legal sector. They are looking for a Data Analyst, who will sit within the Product function, to help drive their digital and web analytics capability.




The business are working on multiple projects to build out new Data products, this person will play a critical role in the build of these products and the efficiency of the overall Data capability.




This role has a Google suite focus (BigQuery, GA and Google Tag Manager). GTM and tagging experience is vital to succeed in this role.




Other responsibilities include:

Optimise end-to-end tracking & insight gathering
Uncover meaningful insights in UB, product performance and key commercial metrics
Work closely with the product development team to ensure innovative data products
Develop and maintain business-wide dashboards
Be the SME for Digital Analytics in the Product and Data team




Please do apply if this role seems of interest.

Title: Trainee Data Analyst
Description:
e-Careers is a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business decisions.

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team.

We are seeking someone who may not have any prior experience, but has the hunger to start a career in data analysis.

We will provide any necessary training and support to help you do your job and build the foundational knowledge to launch a career as a data analyst.

Responsibilities:


Collect, clean, and analyse data from various sources to support business objectives
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data insights
Assist in the development and implementation of data collection systems and strategies
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and present findings to stakeholders
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data quality checks
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis



Requirements


No prior experience or qualifications required. We will provide all the training necessary
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail and organisational skills
Ability to communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner
Eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment



Benefits


Full training provided
Competitive salary and benefits package
Opportunities for professional development and growth
Collaborative and supportive work environment
Access to cutting-edge tools and technologies

Title: Data Analyst - SQL and Python
Description:
At Radius, we provide best in class fleet and connectivity solutions to businesses of all sizes.




Our mission is to help businesses adapt to the future by building solutions for a more sustainable, connected future.




Our comprehensive portfolio of solutions includes fuel cards, telematics, telecoms, insurance, vehicle leasing, EV charging, business energy, and expense management.




We are proud to have over 400,000 customers worldwide, over 50 offices across 5 continents, and over 2,800 talented Radius colleagues.




Technology and data underpin everything we do and have a big part to play in our ongoing growth plans.




This is where you come in…




The role…




We’re looking for a Data Analyst with SQL and Python experience to join our Group Data Science team.




The Data Science team’s main goal is to provide valuable insights to positively impact key business challenges like improving sales conversion, customer churn, etc. These insights are delivered by developing predictive models and analytical solutions while collaborating with business stakeholders.




The role will report to the Head of Group Data Science and will be primarily located at the group’s head office in Crewe.




Your responsibilities will include…




Work with the data scientists and other data analysts to provide insights that aid strategic decision-making for sales, marketing, and account management functions.
Analyse customer and prospect touchpoints on Salesforce CRM and 1st party tools to identify trends that could help tackle key business challenges.
Help deliver targeted Sales and Marketing campaign data on Salesforce CRM through CRUD operations via API.
Work on a diverse range of initiatives for all of Radius’ business units - Fuel, Telematics, Telecoms, Insurance, Vehicle solutions, EV, and Energy.




What do we expect of you?




Minimum 1 year commercial experience working with Python and SQL for Data Analysis.
Passion for driving business impact through data and insights.
Good knowledge of Statistics and Applied Mathematics
Ability to communicate findings through presentations and dashboards.
Good organisation and time-management skills




What can you expect of us?




Your impact on Radius will be rewarded with the opportunity to develop and progress your career in many directions.




You’ll also have access to our competitive reward and benefits package, which includes:




Performance-related bonus scheme
Pension
Life assurance
Employee fuel card scheme
Electric Vehicle scheme
Employee assistance programme
Wellness and healthcare assistance via ‘Help@Hand’ by Unum
‘Cycle to work’ scheme
Free breakfast daily in the office




And of course, you will be part of a modern purpose-built space in Crewe that will provide you with an outstanding working environment complete with onsite gym, café, games areas, and more!




Still curious?




If you feel we are a good match for each other, you can apply online now!




If you’d like to understand more about the role or life at Radius before applying, then please contact our talent team via talent@radius.com.




Radius is an equal opportunities employer. We are committed to welcome people regardless of age, disability, gender identity, race, faith or belief, sexual orientation or socioeconomic background.







Note to Recruitment Agencies

We do not accept unsolicited agency CVs or candidate profiles. Any unsolicited CV or profile received by Radius will be treated as a gift and not eligible for an agency fee. PSL agencies should only send CVs if authorised to do so by the Radius talent team.

Title: Insights Analyst - £32-35,000 - Excel - Remote
Description:
Data Analyst - Excel - Healthtech - Remote - £32-35,000 + Bonus




Scalexperts are partnered with a Healthtech SaaS business, who partner with a huge proportion of the countries healthcare organisations in helping them to optimise their spend. Due to their continued success & growth, this has led to vast amounts of data being shared by their partners which means there is the opportunity to uncover more insights from data and deliver more value.




They are looking for an inquisitive individual to help uncover opportunities and trends in spend data which will help develop insights for their customers. The role will involve engaging proactively with the customers, sharing new opportunities and a new approach to their data. What will make someone successful in this role is the drive to deliver value through data, and a real knack for problem solving. Anyone who has experience of working with large and complex datasets will be at an advantage, as will those who have experience of working with data sets to analyse spending.




Experience in an analytical role, dealing with large, unstructured and complex data sets
Excellent at problem solving
Good Excel skills - knowledge of vlookups and pivot tables is essential
Previous experience in a role with client engagement and stakeholder management would be high beneficial
Able to work as part of a wider team, whilst also being self-motivated




The team works primarily remote and tend to meet up in London once a month

Title: HR Data Analyst
Company: Red Bull Racing & Red Bull Technology
Description:
We are looking for a methodical and organised HR Data Analyst to join our newly remodelled Data Team. You will enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and will be tasked with manipulating and analysing data to produce actionable insights and provide innovative solutions.




In this HR Data Analyst role, you will be managing the end-to-end process of data analytics projects across Human Resources. This role extends to working with the wider business delivering them tailored data solutions including dashboarding and KPI tracking to aid in HR management decisions.




This HR Data Analyst position offers a chance to have a large input into reviewing current data management and reporting processes. As part of this you will be able to implement improvements to systems and work-flow streams and identify opportunities for automation and accuracy of data.




The ideal candidate for this HR Data Analyst position will ideally have:

Previous People Analytics experience preferably in a fast-paced organisation which uses a multitude of systems.
You will have an inquisitive mind, always looking to explore and develop data to aid and support the department, as well as an eye for detail and the ability to deliver accurate and comprehensive data analysis
Proficiency in SQL and SSMS
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel including advanced formulae, pivot tables and vlookups
Experience in Microsoft VBA preferable but not essential
Proficiency in analysing and drawing insights from large datasets
Proven experience of using Data Analytics & Visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau




Not only is this a fantastic HR Data Analyst role, it is also a fantastic team to work for. A good salary is just the start, there are many other benefits too such as our bonus scheme, private health care cover, life assurance scheme, workplace nursery, company contributed pension scheme, on site gym & fitness classes, free food & cycle to work scheme.




Position Information

Position: HR Data Analyst

Location: Red Bull Technology Campus, Milton Keynes (MK7)

Workplace: Office based (4 days per week, 1 day from home)

Hours: 08:30 – 17:30

Title: Data Analyst (Finance) - UK
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 45+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work™ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren't kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They're some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to deliver rock star solutions 🤘

We're looking for a superstar Data Analyst with a strong understanding of finance who doesn't believe there's a data task that can be too hard 🦬

From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value ✨

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 🚀

What You’ll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops


What You'll Need


Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge
Previous experience in the financial/banking industry


Nice to have


Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming
Experience in Accounting


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.


Show more
HTML:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, we've helped 45+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. We've been officially certified as a Great Place to Work™ in recognition of our outstanding employee experience! So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren't kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They're some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to deliver rock star solutions 🤘

We're looking for a superstar Data Analyst with a strong understanding of finance who doesn't believe there's a data task that can be too hard 🦬

From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process, they never stop learning, picking up new skills, and delivering value ✨

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 🚀

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Understanding our business and its processes through our data
  • Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
  • Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
  • Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
  • Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights
  • Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops

What You'll Need

  • Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions
  • Excellent background / education in a quantitative discipline
  • Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
  • Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge
  • Previous experience in the financial/banking industry

Nice to have

  • Advanced degree in a core STEM subject
  • Experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)
  • School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming
  • Experience in Accounting

Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Durham | Utilities | £35,000 - £43,000




Peaple Talent have partnered exclusively with a leading Utilities provider, who are at the forefront of providing innovative and sustainable utility solutions. They are committed to optimizing resource management, ensuring high-quality service, and driving impactful data-driven decisions. Join the dynamic team and contribute to their mission of making utilities smarter and more efficient.




Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Data Analyst to join the team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, with specific experience using Power BI to drive business insights and decision-making. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing complex data sets, creating visually compelling reports, and providing actionable insights to support our strategic goals.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Gather requirements, design solutions and work with stakeholders on their delivery.
Act as business partner for Data Analytics to other teams as required.
Provide regular project/progress reports and resource plans.




Experience needed:

SQL, Advanced Excel.
Advanced skills using Power BI,
Knowledge of SSRS or other BI/Reporting tools.
Organised and reliable with attention to detail.
Bonus points for experience in Development of data models and warehouses.




What We Offer:

💰Salary: £35,000-£43,000

📈Opportunities for professional growth and development.

🤝A collaborative and innovative work environment.

♻️The chance to make a meaningful impact in the utilities industry.

🪙10% matched Pension

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Role: An exciting opportunity is available for a Data Analyst with a deep understanding of the distribution, FMCG, and supply chain industries. The ideal candidate will excel in analysing complex datasets, leveraging business intelligence (BI) tools, and demonstrating strong proficiency in SQL.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret various types of data within the distribution and supply chain sectors to provide actionable insights.
Utilize BI tools to develop and deliver comprehensive reports and dashboards.
Manage and query data using SQL, specifically with P21 data through Epicor.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data-driven solutions.
Develop and maintain data models and data integration processes.




Key Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst, particularly within the distribution, FMCG, or supply chain industries.
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and managing data.
Experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, etc.) to create reports and dashboards.
Ability to understand and analyze P21 data through Epicor.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with various teams.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your New Company

My client believes in valuing people for who they are and advocate for the respect and inclusion of everyone they support in society. No one should be limited in achieving their dreams. With the right support, they believe everyone can live the life they choose.




This is a fantastic opportunity to join this dynamic and forward-thinking organisation at the forefront of a digital transformation. They are committed to innovation and excellence, working collaboratively across IT, Operations, and Central Services Teams to deliver cutting-edge solutions. The team is passionate about leveraging technology to drive efficiency and improve outcomes.




Your New Role

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in supporting the Digital Transformation Programme Manager, Digital Project Managers, and Project Management Officer with project delivery. You will work collaboratively with internal teams and external consultants to analyse existing systems, cleanse data, and ensure successful data migration and testing.

Your responsibilities will include:

Supporting data analysis, cleansing, and migration for digital transformation projects.
Mapping ‘as is’ and ‘to be’ data flows.
Reviewing existing data for duplication, errors, and inconsistencies.
Developing and implementing data quality control tests.
Identifying root causes of data quality issues and recommending solutions.
Presenting data quality findings to management and stakeholders.
Assisting in the development of test plans and coordinating testing of new systems.
Training staff on data quality policies and procedures.




What You’ll Need to Succeed

To excel in this role, you will need:

Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Experience with data analysis, cleansing, and migration.
Capable with Power BI, SQL and excel.
Proficiency in mapping data flows and identifying data quality issues.
Excellent communication skills to present findings and collaborate with stakeholders.
Ability to develop and implement data quality control tests.
Problem-solving skills to identify and address data quality issues.
Experience in training staff on data quality standards and procedures.




What You’ll Get in Return

In return for your expertise and dedication, you’ll get:

A collaborative and innovative work environment.
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
The chance to work on impactful projects that drive digital transformation.
Supportive team culture and access to cutting-edge technology.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst with a balanced mix of technical skills and strong soft skills? Do you have a knack for cleaning and organising raw data and can communicate your insights effectively to a diverse audience?




We are looking for a talented and dynamic individual who is eager to learn and grow, pays meticulous attention to detail, takes responsibility for the accuracy of their work, and communicates their findings clearly. This role offers a unique opportunity to play a significant part in our team's success.




Responsibilities




Cleaning and organising raw data

Mapping data from various sources

Maintaining data attribute tables

Conducting preliminary data investigation and analysis

Building automated workflows

Presenting information using BI tools

Validating automated reporting and uploading reports

Communicating findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders

Ensuring accuracy and attention to detail in all tasks

Specialist/Technical Skills




Strong data analysis and reporting skills

Proficient in using tools like SQL, Alteryx, and Excel for data manipulation

Experience with BI tools to present insights

Comfortable working with large data sets

Interest in or knowledge of finance function is advantageous

Strong problem-solving abilities

Soft Skills and Attributes




Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex information clearly

High attention to detail and commitment to accuracy

Strong business acumen and understanding of how data insights drive business decisions

Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment

Proactive and self-motivated with a desire to learn and grow

If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for data analysis, strong communication skills, and a desire to develop in the field, we want to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst - TikTok LIVE - London
Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touchpoints to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Bachelor’s degree in STEM (science, technology, engineering, math); Advanced Degrees are preferred
- Python is highly preferred
- Attention to detail

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (SQL / PowerBI) | £40,000 - £50,000 | 4 Days / Per Week (West London)




Here at Burns Sheehan, we have partnered up with a well-established name in the UK market for over 20 years who have just been bought out by an experienced leader in the gambling industry as they look to invest heavily within growth and explore International Markets.




As a result, they are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team and report into the Head of Analytics as one of the 1st key hires in this initial growth phase. In this role you will be responsible for taking over the curation and development of a suite of Power BI reports, which are used across all areas of the business to help drive strategy and run the day to day mechanics of the organisation.




Skills and Qualifications:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Similar...
2 + Years experience within Data Analysis
Proficient in SQL / T-SQL and PowerBI (Potentially Tableau)




With a two-decade presence in the UK, this company has a proven track record of success and customer loyalty this an amazing time to join as the companies goes from strength to strength. If you are a Data Analyst with excellent experience across both SQL and PowerBI feel free to apply and I will get back to you accordingly !!!




Data Analyst (SQL / PowerBI) | £40,000 - £50,000 | 4 Days / Per Week (West London)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Aviation




Hampshire Based

Onsite during induction period, then 1 day onsite / 4 days WFH.




Are you a data whiz with a passion for aviation? Ready to soar to new heights in your career?




Our client, a leading aviation company specialising in the distribution of consumable and expendable aero parts, is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their purchasing team and spearhead data-driven decision-making in the aviation sector.




Why Join Us?

Innovative Environment: Work with cutting-edge technology and data models in a forward-thinking company.
Impactful Role: Your insights will directly influence strategic business decisions and operational efficiency.
Career Growth: Endless opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
Flexible Working: Enjoy the freedom of remote working after initial training at their HQ in Hampshire.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyse large datasets from multiple sources within the aviation industry.
Develop and implement data models, algorithms, and visualisations to uncover hidden insights.
Identify key performance indicators (KPIs) and create eye-catching reports and dashboards to monitor them.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and provide data-driven recommendations.
Stay ahead of the curve with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis and aviation technology.




What We’re Looking For:

Experience: Proven experience as a Data Analyst in the aviation industry or a related field.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, or SAS.
Analytical Mindset: Strong problem-solving skills with a sharp attention to detail.
Communication: Excellent ability to present complex information clearly and concisely.




Salary:

Competitive, subject to experience




Working Hours:

Monday – Friday, 37.5 hours




Additional Perks:

Flexible Working: Remote work options available post-training
Professional Development: Access to exciting training and development programs




If you're ready to take your career to new heights and make an impact in the aviation industry, our client would love to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Remote




Description:

We are seeking a Business Data Analyst to support our People Services in a large HRIS transformation project. You'll work with stakeholders to analyze and document requirements, particularly within HRIS and Payroll, ensuring seamless integration and efficiency improvements.




Key Skills and Experience:

Minimum 3 years of Business Analyst experience.
Proven track record in shared services and HR system implementations.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Experience with HR platforms like Workday, SAP, Oracle, Ceridian is a plus.
Ability to develop and monitor KPIs for process improvements.

Key Responsibilities:

Gather and document shared service requirements.
Analyze business processes and identify improvement opportunities.
Translate requirements into practical solutions with the project team.
Support the implementation and address any challenges.
Ensure alignment of shared services with project goals.
Continuously identify and implement improvements.

HTML:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Remote


Description:

We are seeking a Business Data Analyst to support our People Services in a large HRIS transformation project. You'll work with stakeholders to analyze and document requirements, particularly within HRIS and Payroll, ensuring seamless integration and efficiency improvements.


Key Skills and Experience:

  • Minimum 3 years of Business Analyst experience.
  • Proven track record in shared services and HR system implementations.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Experience with HR platforms like Workday, SAP, Oracle, Ceridian is a plus.
  • Ability to develop and monitor KPIs for process improvements.

  • Key Responsibilities:

    • Gather and document shared service requirements.
    • Analyze business processes and identify improvement opportunities.
    • Translate requirements into practical solutions with the project team.
    • Support the implementation and address any challenges.
    • Ensure alignment of shared services with project goals.
    • Continuously identify and implement improvements.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst Opportunity at Award-Winning FinTech Company




We are excited to announce an opening for a proactive Data Analyst at an award-winning, rapidly growing fintech client of ours based near Lancaster.




Position Details:




Type: Remote-first (onsite requirement once every fortnight, travel subsidized)

Location: Circa Lancaster




You’d be a great fit if you:




Are comfortable working with large datasets and statistical analysis.
Have strong skills in a data visualization tool.
Possess strong SQL skills.
Have experience with Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Have a background or interest in Insurance and/or FinTech (preferred but not essential).

There is significant potential for growth within the business, allowing you to truly make this role your own.

Looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

As an AWF Business Intelligence Analyst on the Global Ads Marketing team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Q4 peak season planning. You will collaborate closely with the Business Intelligence Lead to analyze data trends, develop insightful reports, and contribute to the strategic execution of our advertising campaigns. Your expertise will help optimize our ad performance and ensure a successful peak season.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Marketing Managers to align data analysis with overall Ads product strategy.
Assist with the development and implementation of operational tools for peak season planning, becoming the go-to expert.
Work with cross-functional teams to support operational excellence and drive automation initiatives.
Engage with global stakeholders to provide data-driven insights and recommendations for Ads product enhancements.
Take charge of data collection, analysis, and reporting tasks to support decision-making during Q4 peak season.
Contribute to the design and execution of A/B testing to optimize campaign performance.
Synthesize complex data into actionable reports for the marketing team and senior management.
Assist in the management and quality assurance of campaign content and audience targeting.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 1 year of experience in a data analysis role ideally within a marketing or ad-tech environment.
Proficient in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.
Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of handling multiple tasks with precision.
Excellent communication skills, with the aptitude to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive mindset, with a willingness to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

What We Offer:

A creative and collaborative workplace where your contributions are recognized.
A supportive team that values innovation and data-driven decision-making.

Join us and be a part of shaping the future of advertising during our most exciting time of the year!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Junior Data Analyst




Want to start a career in tech?

Albany Beck are hiring for passionate individuals to join the Pioneer Technology Programme, to learn the skills to become Junior Data Analysts. This will give you the opportunity to channel your enthusiasm and be part of an Agile team who are always working with exciting technologies. At the end of a short training period, you will be placed into your first full-time position as a Data Analyst with a Public Sector client of ours!




Why Choose the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme?

By choosing to join our Pioneer Technology Programme, you’ll be choosing to work with an organisation that’s passionate about your learning journey and committed to your ongoing professional development. The programme combines a world-class training, with the potential to gain industry standard professional qualifications.




What to expect on the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme

A training course on Data Analysis, where you will learn skills on Python, SQL, PowerBI, AWS and Excel
Deployment to a mainstream Public Sector firm upon completion, allowing you to work with cutting edge technologies.
An Engagement Manager will be assigned to you before your first day who will support you throughout your placement whilst keeping your progression on track, answering any questions about the project and providing upskilling support as required.
A great social environment where you are surrounded by likeminded consultants, you can expect various social events arranged by your Engagement Manager with not just your team but other Pioneers too.




What You Need

Bachelor's degree STEM subject (science, technology, engineering, math) OR, a Non-STEM degree or qualifications provided you have a passion for technology - either through doing online courses, building websites or learning technology in your spare time
British, EEA or Commonwealth Citizen




What You’ll Get

Fully funded training through classes and one on one coaching
Competitive graduate salary, once placed, and half year pay reviews
Ongoing training and support through your designated AB Coach
An inclusive environment, here at AB we believe in increasing representation and making sure everyone can bring their whole self to work. We don't just say the right things, we do the right thing and remove barriers to entry into Technology.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Rakuten Viber is one of the most popular and downloaded apps in the world. Working with us provides a unique opportunity to influence hundreds of millions of our users and to be part of the journey that makes us a super-app. Our mission is to make people’s lives easier by enabling meaningful connections, from precious moments with family and friends, through managing business relationships to pursuing their passions.

Our Data Analyst team provides insights on how millions of users interact with our products. As a Data Analyst, you will be part of the Business Solutions unit and deliver insights that translate directly into business growth.

Working hand-in-hand with the global managers for each region, you will spot new opportunities, challenge the status quo, and present your findings back to the leadership team. We are looking for an experienced, hands-on individual with both strong technical skills (SQL, Python / R, and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Excel, Looker, etc.) and a business mindset.

Responsibilities:


Deliver cutting-edge analytics projects optimizing across regions, channels, and analytical functions
Report on key performance metrics against targets on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis and provide actionable insights to improve performance
Liaise with stakeholders, such as Product, Marketing, Analytics and Data Science teams to drive step changes in growth
Share expertise and best practices within analytical functions to develop a shared center of excellence
Proactively craft stories from data to clearly identify opportunities in improving user experiences
Build and maintain reporting dashboards, reports, and data models


Requirements:


2+ years experience in a role equivalent to data or business analysis
Analytical and problem-solving skills
An ability to communicate complex findings to key stakeholders in a clear, simple way
Knowledge of A/B testing principles and statistical analysis techniques
Good command of Excel, experience with SQL and BI software (ideally Tableau, Looker or similar)
BSc degree (or higher) in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science or any other quantitative field


Advantages:


Experience in product analytics role with driving impact and shaping product direction
Experience with Python and ETL
Experience with simple ML algorithms and technical skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are recruiting for a Data Analyst to be responsible for the collection and analysis of data from various sources in order to provide insights and solutions for various business problems using various tools and techniques, such as statistics, programming, databases, visualisation and machine learning.




The role will support all areas of the business to support the integration and ongoing transformation of our sales, support and operational functions.




Overview of duties:




Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytics systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks
Work closely with senior leadership, international data team members, and project managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytics needs, including critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers
Proactively analyse data to answer key questions for stakeholders, with an eye on what drives business performance, and investigate and communicate which areas need improvement in efficiency and productivity
Create and maintain rich interactive visualisations through data interpretation and analysis, with reporting components from multiple data sources
Define and implement data acquisition and integration logic, selecting an appropriate combination of methods and tools within the defined technology stack to ensure optimal scalability and performance of the solution
Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across datasets
Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex datasets
Evaluate organizational methods and provide source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for datasets
Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data




Person specification:




Knowledge, skills and abilities:




Proven analytics skills, including mining, evaluation, and visualisation
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations
Experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques
Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment




Education / and or Experience:




Minimum of three years’ experience mining data as a Data Analyst
Insurance or financial services experience preferred
Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages, including Excel, PowerBI, SPSS, and SAS
Strong programming experience with frameworks, including XML, JavaScript, and ETL




Key information:




Hours: Monday – Friday, 35 Hours

Location: Bromsgrove, Hybrid




If this sounds like something you are interested in please apply, or contact Paige Hughes or Lucy Reed for further information.
